TopicTitle: When did you buy KSP? (I want to know how many people waited for it to come out of Early Access)

Articles.Content: 2012-12-10, can't even remember what version that was, then I bought it again when it released onto Steam.

Tried it at v0.13.0 (before they added Minmus)

Bought it at v0.15.0

Enjoyed it ever since. Haven't transferred to Steam yet, but if I do I'm going to buy it there instead of getting a Steam key thru the Squad store. It's the least I can do for a game that's brought me this much enjoyment!

I think the ones who waited for 1.0 or didn't hear about it properly until 1.0 haven't been assimilated into the forums yet. I for one played long before looking up the forums. (half a year or so).

I'm sure we'll see a lot of necwcomers in the next few months, and if this poll was posted then, the results would've been slightly different.

Started **playing** KSP at 0.7-0.8 (can't remember which), the days before struts, meaningful SAS, strap on liquid boosters (could only attach solids to the radial mounts), no symmetry or angle snap. Oh, and no time acceleration either. Every launch was an exercise in hilarious, wobbly, misaligned torture, with no ultimate objective other than highest escape velocity.

My wife finally **bought** it for me for Xmas 2012, (around version 0.18 then) the lure of all them planets was too much for me to resist!

March 2013, when 0.19 came out and the game became available on Steam.
I bought it on release day. Alpha release day that is, june 2011. Paid $7 (I believe) and it feels like the biggest steal in history after over 1000 hours played!
Aug 2013 ... i think it was 0.21
Been playing since .19 in March 2013.
Rover Update. <3

.17 at the latest. 

I think it was .15, since I seem to remember quite a long time of thinking "Gee, what this game really needs is the ability to dock on orbit!" and I'm pretty sure it was the space-plane parts that got me to actually buy.
January 2014, not that long ago, but I remember the days before cargo bays when Giggleplex's shuttle ruled the spacecraft exchange
i brought it on my forum join date. June 2013
I bought it the week before school. to be exact, just during washington sakuracon

I tried the demo in August 2013 and at first I thought it was a crappy game. ended up buying it a few weeks later. I think it was 0.21 back then

Some 1700 hours on record...

I believe I bought it at version 0.18. It was quite a while between then and when I joined this forum, which I guess explains your poll result. I do seem to recall somebody posting that it was their #1 download right after the 1.0 release, so clearly quite a few people did wait.

....OK, reading upthread people said the game wasn't even on Steam until 0.19, so I guess that must have been when I bought it.
I had the demo for a while (the old 0.18 one), and I bought the full game only 6 or 7 days after the release of 0.21. Interesting how well that lined up with the release of a major version.

I think I joined in a version or two after the .18 demo, as I found the game had more stuff than the demo.

I do miss Ye Olde VAB =(
